gem_process.name: The Gem Process (WeDo Thread)
gem_process.summary: The singular, shared thread of attention between user and agent is the irreducible foundation of the system.
gem_process.description: The interaction between the user and the agent constitutes a single, continuous thread of execution and attention. This thread is the driver for all system complexity.
gem_process.implication: Because the agent process operates within this single thread, it cannot dynamically modify its own foundational parameters (like the underlying AI model) while running. Such meta-operations require an external intervention.
gem_process.rule: Agents must design long-running or multi-stage workflows with explicit checkpoints or stops. These pauses allow the user to perform necessary meta-tasks (model switching, resource allocation) that the agent cannot perform on itself. The agent must yield control to the user to maintain the health and capability of the shared thread.
